education.area: Computer Engineering, minor in Cognitive Science

work.name: UCSD Kastner Research Group
summary: HoLmeS: ran Sherlock across various datasets to benchmark its performance and prototyped enhancements to increase its accuracy and adaptability

work.name: UCSD WukLab
summary: Systems for Augmented Language Models: constructed a retrieval API in Python that, given search terms, efficiently delivers pertinent information from the Wikipedia dump sourced from KILT

work.name: UCSD CSE Department
summary: CSE 110: tutored over 400 students enrolled in Advanced Data Structures, explaining challenging concepts to them

work.name: UCSD Translational Neuroengineering Lab
summary: Labeled sessions of zebra finch behavior based on analysis of audio waveform and spectrogram data

publications.name: Computer Vision for Primate Identification
publications.publisher: Andy Meza, Yu-Shu Chen, Jack Terwilliger
publications.summary: This paper focuses on developing a computer vision system for identifying individual primates, leveraging a combination of synthetic datasets and real-world video footage.

publications.name: HoLmeS: Design Space Exploration for High-Level Synthesis
publications.publisher: Andy Meza, Yu-Shu Chen, Chima Tochukwu Nwughala
publications.summary: Sherlock is a flexible DSE framework for finding Pareto-optimal solutions in a variety of design spaces. In this work, we evaluate Sherlock's performance against that of other state-of-the-art DSE frameworks.

publications.name: Interpretable Spiking Neural Network for Basic Mathematical Operations
publications.summary: We propose a spiking neural network designed to function as a declarative memory network.

publications.name: A Study of Large Language Models' Ability to Perform Basic Math Operations in Different Bases
publications.summary: In this paper, I explore large language Models' mathematical reasoning abilities through their performance on simple mathematical tasks.
